analyzed: sattāvāsa vagga
translated: The Book of the Threes

original: Assakhaḷuṅkasutta
analyzed: assa khaḷuṅka sutta
translated: The Stubborn Horse

original: “Tayo ca, bhikkhave, assakhaḷuṅke desessāmi tayo ca purisakhaḷuṅke tayo ca assaparasse tayo ca purisaparasse tayo ca bhadde assājānīye tayo ca bhadde purisājānīye.
analyzed: tayo ca bhikkhave assa khaḷuṅke desessāmi tayo ca purisa khaḷuṅke tayo ca assa parasse tayo ca purisa parasse tayo ca bhadde assājānīye tayo ca bhadde purisājānīye
translated: “Monks, I will teach you three kinds of stubborn horses, three kinds of bad humans, three kinds of good horses, three kinds of good humans, three good thoroughbred horses, and three good thoroughbred humans.

original: Taṁ suṇātha. (…)
analyzed: tam suṇātha
translated: Listen and pay careful attention, I will speak.”

original: Katame ca, bhikkhave, tayo assakhaḷuṅkā?🔽Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco assakhaḷuṅko javasampanno hoti, na vaṇṇasampanno, na ārohapariṇāhasampanno.
analyzed: katame ca bhikkhave tayo assa khaḷuṅkā  idha bhikkhave ekaccaḥ assa khaḷuṅkaḥ java sampannaḥ hoti na vaṇṇa sampannaḥ na āroha pariṇāha sampannaḥ
translated: “And what are the three kinds of stubborn horses?🔽There is the case where a certain stubborn horse is endowed with speed but not with beauty or the right proportions.

original: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco assakhaḷuṅko javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca, na ārohapariṇāhasampanno.
analyzed: idha pana bhikkhave ekaccaḥ assa khaḷuṅkaḥ java sampannaḥ ca hoti vaṇṇa sampannaḥ ca na āroha pariṇāha sampannaḥ
translated: There is the case where a certain stubborn horse is endowed with speed and beauty but not with the right proportions.

original: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco assakhaḷuṅko javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca ārohapariṇāhasampanno ca.
analyzed: idha pana bhikkhave ekaccaḥ assa khaḷuṅkaḥ java sampannaḥ ca hoti vaṇṇa sampannaḥ ca āroha pariṇāha sampanno ca
translated: “Here, bhikkhus, some horse is endowed with speed but not with beauty and capacity.

original: Ime kho, bhikkhave, tayo assakhaḷuṅkā.
analyzed: ime kho bhikkhave tayaḥ assa khaḷuṅkā
translated: These are the three kinds of horses.

original: Katame ca, bhikkhave, tayo purisakhaḷuṅkā?🔽Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco purisakhaḷuṅko javasampanno hoti, na vaṇṇasampanno, na ārohapariṇāhasampanno.
analyzed: katame ca bhikkhave tayo purisa khaḷuṅkā  idha bhikkhave ekaccaḥ purisa khaḷuṅkaḥ java sampannaḥ hoti na vaṇṇa sampannaḥ na āroha pariṇāha sampannaḥ
translated: “And what, bhikkhus, are the three kinds of men?🔽“Here, bhikkhus, some man is endowed with speed but not with beauty and capacity.

original: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco purisakhaḷuṅko javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca, na ārohapariṇāhasampanno.
analyzed: idha pana bhikkhave ekaccaḥ purisa khaḷuṅkaḥ java sampannaḥ ca hoti vaṇṇa sampannaḥ ca na āroha pariṇāha sampanno
translated: “Here, bhikkhus, some man is endowed with speed and with beauty but not with capacity.

original: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco purisakhaḷuṅko javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca ārohapariṇāhasampanno ca.
analyzed: idha pana bhikkhave ekaccaḥ purisa khaḷuṅkaḥ java sampanno ca hoti vaṇṇa sampanno ca āroha pariṇāha sampanno ca
translated: “Here, bhikkhus, some man is endowed with speed, with beauty, and with capacity.

original: Kathañca, bhikkhave, purisakhaḷuṅko javasampanno hoti, na vaṇṇasampanno na ārohapariṇāhasampanno?
analyzed: katham ca bhikkhave purisa khaḷuṅkaḥ java sampannaḥ hoti na vaṇṇa sampannaḥ na āroha pariṇāha sampannaḥ
translated: “And how, bhikkhus, is a man endowed with speed but not with beauty and capacity?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ‘idaṁ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti, ‘ayaṁ dukkhasamudayo’ti
analyzed: idha bhikkhave bhikkhu idam dukkhanti yathābhūtam pajānāti ayam dukkha samudayaḥ ti
translated: “Here, bhikkhus, a bhikkhu understands as it actually is thus: ‘This is suffering’; he understands as it actually is thus: ‘This is the origin of suffering’;

original: yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti, ‘ayaṁ dukkhanirodho’ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti, ‘ayaṁ dukkhanirodhagāminī
analyzed: yathābhūtam pajānāti ayam dukkha nirodhaḥ iti yathābhūtam pajānāti ayam dukkha nirodha gāminī
translated: he knows as it really is: ‘This is the cessation of suffering’, he knows as it really is: ‘This is the way leading to the cessation of suffering’,

original: paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti.
analyzed: yathābhūtam pajānāti
translated: he understands as it really is: ‘This is the cessation of suffering’; he understands as it really is: ‘This is the way leading to the cessation of suffering.’

original: Idamassa javasmiṁ vadāmi.
analyzed: idam assa javasmin vadāmi
translated: This is what I call speed.

original: Abhidhamme kho pana abhivinaye pañhaṁ puṭṭho saṁsādeti, no vissajjeti.
analyzed: abhidhamme kho pana abhivinaye pañham puṭṭhaḥ sasādeti no vissajjeti
translated: But when questioned about the detailed meaning, he falters and is unable to explain.

original: Idamassa na vaṇṇasmiṁ vadāmi.
analyzed: idam assa na vaṇṇasmim vadāmi
translated: This is what I call not having good colour.

original: Na kho pana lābhī hoti cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānapaccayabhesajjaparikkhārānaṁ.
analyzed: na kho pana lābhī hoti cīvara piṇḍapāta senāsana gilāna paccaya bhesajja parikkhārāna
translated: And he does not obtain robes, almsfood, resting places, and medicinal requisites.

original: Idamassa na ārohapariṇāhasmiṁ vadāmi.🔽Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, purisakhaḷuṅko javasampanno hoti, na vaṇṇasampanno na ārohapariṇāhasampanno.
analyzed: idam assa naḥ āroha pariṇāhasmim vadāmi  evam kho bhikkhave purisa khaḷuṅkaḥ java sampannaḥ hoti na vaṇṇa sampannaḥ na āroha pariṇāha sampannaḥ
translated: This is what I call not having a good build.🔽This is how a human being is quick but not well-coloured or well-built.

original: Kathañca, bhikkhave, purisakhaḷuṅko javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca, na ārohapariṇāhasampanno?
analyzed: katham ca bhikkhave purisa khaḷuṅkaḥ java sampannaḥ ca hoti vaṇṇa sampannaḥ ca na āroha pariṇāha sampannaḥ
translated: “And how is a human being quick and well-coloured but not well-built?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ‘idaṁ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti …pe… ‘ayaṁ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti.
analyzed: idha bhikkhave bhikkhu idam dukkhanti yathābhūtam pajānāti pe ayam dukkha nirodha gāminī paṭipadā ati yathābhūtam pajānāti
translated: There is the case where a monk discerns, as it actually is, that ‘This is stress… This is the origination of stress… This is the cessation of stress… This is the way leading to the cessation of stress.

original: Idamassa javasmiṁ vadāmi.
analyzed: idam assa javasmin vadāmi
translated: This, I tell you, is his speed.

original: Abhidhamme kho pana abhivinaye pañhaṁ puṭṭho vissajjeti, no saṁsādeti.
analyzed: abhidhamme kho pana abhivinaye pañham puṭṭhaḥ vissajjeti no sasādeti
translated: And when questioned about the Dhamma & Vinaya, he answers, doesn’t mangle the meaning, and doesn’t contradict the Dhamma.

original: Idamassa vaṇṇasmiṁ vadāmi.
analyzed: idam assa vaṇṇasmim vadāmi
translated: This, I tell you, is his beauty.

original: Na kho pana lābhī hoti cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānapaccayabhesajjaparikkhārānaṁ.
analyzed: na kho pana lābhī hoti cīvara piṇḍapāta senāsana gilāna paccaya bhesajja parikkhārāna
translated: But he doesn’t receive robes, alms food, lodgings, or medicinal requisites for the sick.

original: Idamassa na ārohapariṇāhasmiṁ vadāmi.
analyzed: idam assa naḥ āroha pariṇāhasmim vadāmi
translated: This, I tell you, is his lack of height & bulk.

original: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, purisakhaḷuṅko javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca, na ārohapariṇāhasampanno.
analyzed: evam kho bhikkhave purisa khaḷuṅkaḥ java sampannaḥ ca hoti vaṇṇa sampannaḥ ca na āroha pariṇāha sampannaḥ
translated: This is called a person who is swift and beautiful but lacks height & bulk.

original: Kathañca, bhikkhave, purisakhaḷuṅko javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca ārohapariṇāhasampanno ca?
analyzed: katham ca bhikkhave purisa khaḷuṅkaḥ java sampannaḥ ca hoti vaṇṇa sampannaḥ ca āroha pariṇāha sampanno ca
translated: And what is a person who is swift, beautiful, and has height & bulk?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ‘idaṁ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti …pe… ‘ayaṁ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti.
analyzed: idha bhikkhave bhikkhu idam dukkhanti yathābhūtam pajānāti pe ayam dukkha nirodha gāminī paṭipadā ati yathābhūtam pajānāti
translated: There is the case where a monk discerns, as it actually is, that ‘This is stress… This is the origination of stress… This is the cessation of stress… This is the way leading to the cessation of stress.

original: Idamassa javasmiṁ vadāmi.
analyzed: idam assa javasmin vadāmi
translated: This, I tell you, is his speed.

original: Abhidhamme kho pana abhivinaye pañhaṁ puṭṭho vissajjeti, no saṁsādeti.
analyzed: abhidhamme kho pana abhivinaye pañham puṭṭhaḥ vissajjeti no sasādeti
translated: And when questioned about the Dhamma & Vinaya, he answers without getting stuck.

original: Idamassa vaṇṇasmiṁ vadāmi.🔽Lābhī kho pana hoti cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānapaccayabhesajjaparikkhārānaṁ.
analyzed: idam assa vaṇṇasmim vadāmi  lābhī kho pana hoti cīvara piṇḍapāta senāsana gilāna paccaya bhesajja parikkhārāna
translated: This, I tell you, is his beauty.🔽He is a receiver of robes, alms food, lodgings, & medicinal requisites for the sick.

original: Idamassa ārohapariṇāhasmiṁ vadāmi.
analyzed: idam assa āroha pariṇāhasmin vadāmi
translated: This, I tell you, is his height & width.

original: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, purisakhaḷuṅko javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca ārohapariṇāhasampanno ca.
analyzed: evam kho bhikkhave purisa khaḷuṅkaḥ java sampannaḥ ca hoti vaṇṇa sampannaḥ ca āroha pariṇāha sampannaḥ ca
translated: This is how a human thoroughbred is consummate in speed, consummate in beauty, & consummate in height & width.

original: Ime kho, bhikkhave, tayo purisakhaḷuṅkā.
analyzed: ime kho bhikkhave tayo purisa khaḷuṅkā
translated: These are the three kinds of human thoroughbreds.

original: Katame ca, bhikkhave, tayo assaparassā?
analyzed: katame ca bhikkhave tayo assa parassā
translated: “And which are the three kinds of thoroughbred horses?🔽There is the case where a thoroughbred horse is consummate in speed but not in beauty or height & width.

original: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco assaparasso …pe…
analyzed: idha bhikkhave ekaccaḥ assa parassaḥ pe
translated: He is consummate in speed, consummate in beauty, but not in height & width.

original: javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca ārohapariṇāhasampanno ca.
analyzed: java sampannaḥ ca hoti vaṇṇa sampanno ca āroha pariṇāha sampanno ca
translated: He is consummate in speed, consummate in beauty, consummate in height & width.

original: Ime kho, bhikkhave, tayo assaparassā.
analyzed: ime kho bhikkhave tayo assa parassā
translated: These are the three kinds of thoroughbred horses.

analyzed: katame ca bhikkhave tayaḥ bhaddā purisājānīyā  idha bhikkhave ekaccaḥ bhaddaḥ purisājānīyaḥ pe

analyzed: vinicchayam paṭicca chanda rāgaḥ chanda rāgam paṭicca ajjhosāna ajjhosānam paṭicca  pariggahaḥ pariggaham paṭicca macchariya macchariyam paṭicca ārakkhaḥ ārakkha adhikaraṇa

analyzed: sattāvāsa vagga

original: Sattāvāsasutta
analyzed: sattāvāsa sutta
translated: The Seven Abodes

original: “Navayime, bhikkhave, sattāvāsā.
analyzed: navayime bhikkhave sattāvāsā
translated: “Monks, there are these seven abodes of beings.

original: Katame nava?
analyzed: katame nava
translated: What are the seven?

original: Santi, bhikkhave, sattā nānattakāyā nānattasaññino, seyyathāpi manussā, ekacce ca devā, ekacce ca vinipātikā.
analyzed: santi bhikkhave sattāḥ nānatta kāyāḥ nānatta saññinaḥ seyyathā api manussāḥ ekacce ca devāḥ ekacce ca vinipātikā
translated: There are beings that are manifold in body and manifold in perception, such as human beings, some gods, and some beings in the lower realms.

original: Ayaṁ paṭhamo sattāvāso.
analyzed: ayam paṭhamaḥ sattāvāsaḥ
translated: This is the first abode of beings.

original: Santi, bhikkhave, sattā nānattakāyā ekattasaññino, seyyathāpi devā brahmakāyikā paṭhamābhinibbattā.
analyzed: santi bhikkhave sattāḥ nānatta kāyāḥ ekatta saññinaḥ seyyathā api devāḥ brahmakāyikā paṭhama abhinibbattā
translated: There are creatures with multiplicity of body and multiplicity of perception, such as human beings, some gods, and some denizens of the states of deprivation.

original: Ayaṁ dutiyo sattāvāso.
analyzed: ayam dutiyaḥ sattāvāsaḥ
translated: This is the second abode of creatures.

original: Santi, bhikkhave, sattā ekattakāyā nānattasaññino, seyyathāpi devā ābhassarā.
analyzed: santi bhikkhave sattāḥ ekatta kāyāḥ nānatta saññinaḥ seyyathā api devāḥ ābhassarā
translated: There are creatures with multiplicity of body and singularity of perception, such as the gods of the retinue of Brahma who arose first in the aeon.

original: Ayaṁ tatiyo sattāvāso.
analyzed: ayam tatiyaḥ sattāvāsaḥ
translated: This is the third abode of creatures.

original: Santi, bhikkhave, sattā ekattakāyā ekattasaññino, seyyathāpi devā subhakiṇhā.
analyzed: santi bhikkhave sattāḥ ekatta kāyāḥ ekatta saññinaḥ seyyathā api devā subha kiṇhā
translated: There are creatures with singularity of body and multiplicity of perception, such as the Radiant Gods.

original: Ayaṁ catuttho sattāvāso.
analyzed: ayam catutthaḥ sattāvāso
translated: This is the fourth abode of creatures.

original: Santi, bhikkhave, sattā asaññino appaṭisaṁvedino, seyyathāpi devā asaññasattā.
analyzed: santi bhikkhave sattāḥ asaññinaḥ appaṭisavedinaḥ seyyathā api devāḥ asañña sattā
translated: There are creatures without perception, who are mind-made, feeding on rapture, who arise spontaneously and are of radiant form, such as the Gods of Refulgent Glory.

original: Ayaṁ pañcamo sattāvāso.
analyzed: ayam pañcamaḥ sattāvāsaḥ
translated: This is the fifth abode of creatures.

original: Santi, bhikkhave, sattā sabbaso rūpasaññānaṁ samatikkamā paṭighasaññānaṁ atthaṅgamā nānattasaññānaṁ amanasikārā ‘ananto ākāso’ti ākāsānañcāyatanūpagā.
analyzed: santi bhikkhave sattā sabbaso rūpa saññānam samatikkamā paṭigha saññānam atthaṅgamā nānatta saññānam amanasikārā anantaḥ ākāsaḥ ti ākāsa anañca āyatana upagā
translated: There are creatures who have entirely transcended perceptions of form, the perception of impingement, and the perception of multiplicity. Aware that ‘space is infinite,’ they have been reborn in the base of infinite space.

original: Ayaṁ chaṭṭho sattāvāso.
analyzed: ayam chaṭṭhaḥ sattāvāso
translated: This is the sixth abode of creatures.

original: Santi, bhikkhave, sattā sabbaso ākāsānañcāyatanaṁ samatikkamma ‘anantaṁ viññāṇan’ti viññāṇañcāyatanūpagā.
analyzed: santi bhikkhave sattā sabbaso ākāsānañca āyatanam samatikkamma anantam viññāṇanti viññāṇañcāyatana upagā
translated: There are beings who, with the complete surmounting of the dimension of the infinitude of space, ‘Infinite consciousness,’ arrive at the dimension of the infinitude of consciousness.

original: Ayaṁ sattamo sattāvāso.
analyzed: ayam sattamaḥ sattāvāsaḥ
translated: This is the seventh abode of beings.

original: Santi, bhikkhave, sattā sabbaso viññāṇañcāyatanaṁ samatikkamma ‘natthi kiñcī’ti ākiñcaññāyatanūpagā.
analyzed: santi bhikkhave sattā sabbasas viññāṇañca āyatanam samatikkamma na atthi kiñci iti ākiñcaññāyatana upagā
translated: There are beings who, with the complete surmounting of the dimension of the infinitude of consciousness, ‘There is nothing at all,’ arrive at the dimension of nothingness.

original: Ayaṁ aṭṭhamo sattāvāso.
analyzed: ayam aṭṭhamaḥ sattāvāso
translated: This is the eighth abode of beings.

original: Santi, bhikkhave, sattā sabbaso ākiñcaññāyatanaṁ samatikkamma nevasaññānāsaññāyatanūpagā.
analyzed: santi bhikkhave sattā sabbasas ākiñcaññāyatanam samatikkamma nevasaññānāsaññāyatana upagā
translated: There are beings who, with the complete surmounting of the dimension of nothingness, arrive at the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: Ayaṁ navamo sattāvāso.
analyzed: ayam navamaḥ sattāvāsaḥ
translated: This is the ninth abode of beings.

original: Ime kho, bhikkhave, nava sattāvāsā”ti.🔽Catutthaṁ.🔽Aṅguttara Nikāya 9.25
analyzed: ime kho bhikkhave nava sattāvāsā ati  catuttha  aṅguttara nikāya
translated: “These, monks, are the nine abodes of beings.”🔽The fourth section on the nine abodes of beings is finished.🔽The Book of the Tens

original: Paññāsutta
analyzed: paññāsutta
translated: Fifty

original: “Yato kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno paññāya cittaṁ suparicitaṁ hoti, tassetaṁ, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno kallaṁ vacanāya:
analyzed: yatas kho bhikkhave bhikkhuno paññāya cittam su paricitam hoti tassa ita bhikkhave bhikkhuno kallam vacanāya
translated: “When a monk’s mind is well-purified through wisdom, it’s fitting for him to say:

original: ‘khīṇā jāti, vusitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ, kataṁ karaṇīyaṁ, nāparaṁ itthattāyāti pajānāmī’ti.
analyzed: brahmacariya katam karaṇīya na aparam itthattāya ati pajānāmi iti
translated: ‘I understand: Birth is ended, the holy life fulfilled, the task done. There is nothing further for this world.’”

original: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno paññāya cittaṁ suparicitaṁ hoti?🔽‘Vītarāgaṁ me cittan’ti paññāya cittaṁ suparicitaṁ hoti;
analyzed: katham ca bhikkhave bhikkhuno paññāya cittam su paricitam hoti  vīta rāgam me cittanti paññāya cittam su paricitam hoti
translated: And how does a monastic have a mind well-developed with wisdom?🔽‘My mind is free from lust’—a monastic has a mind well-developed with wisdom.

original: ‘vītadosaṁ me cittan’ti paññāya cittaṁ suparicitaṁ hoti;🔽‘vītamohaṁ me cittan’ti paññāya cittaṁ suparicitaṁ hoti;
analyzed: vīta dosam me cittanti paññāya cittam su paricitam hoti  vīta moham me cittanti paññāya cittam su paricitam hoti
translated: ‘My mind is free from hate’—a monastic has a mind well-developed with wisdom.🔽‘My mind is free from delusion’—a monastic has a mind well-developed with wisdom.

original: ‘asarāgadhammaṁ me cittan’ti paññāya cittaṁ suparicitaṁ hoti;🔽‘asadosadhammaṁ me cittan’ti paññāya cittaṁ suparicitaṁ hoti;
analyzed: a sa rāga dhammam me cittanti paññāya cittam su paricitam hoti  asa dosa dhammam me cittanti paññāya cittam su paricitam hoti
translated: ‘My mind is not subject to lust’—a monastic has a mind well-developed with wisdom.🔽‘My mind is not subject to hate’—a monastic has a mind well-developed with wisdom.

original: ‘asamohadhammaṁ me cittan’ti paññāya cittaṁ suparicitaṁ hoti;🔽‘anāvattidhammaṁ me cittaṁ kāmabhavāyā’ti paññāya cittaṁ suparicitaṁ hoti;🔽‘anāvattidhammaṁ me cittaṁ rūpabhavāyā’ti paññāya cittaṁ suparicitaṁ hoti;
analyzed: asa moha dhammam me cittanti paññāya cittam su paricitam hoti  an āvatti dhammam me cittam kāma bhavāya ati paññāya cittam su paricitam hoti  an āvatti dhammam me cittam rūpa bhavāya ati paññāya cittam su paricitam hoti
translated: ‘My mind is not subject to delusion’—a monastic has a mind well-developed with wisdom.🔽‘My mind will not return to the sensual realm’—a monastic has a mind well-developed with wisdom.🔽‘My mind will not return to the form realm’—a monastic has a mind well-developed with wisdom.

original: ‘anāvattidhammaṁ me cittaṁ arūpabhavāyā’ti paññāya cittaṁ suparicitaṁ hoti.
analyzed: an āvatti dhammam me cittam a rūpa bhavāya ati paññāya cittam su paricitam hoti
translated: ‘My mind will not return to the formless realm’—a monastic has a mind well-developed with wisdom.

original: Yato kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno paññāya cittaṁ suparicitaṁ hoti, tassetaṁ, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno kallaṁ vacanāya:
analyzed: yatas kho bhikkhave bhikkhuno paññāya cittam su paricitam hoti tassa ita bhikkhave bhikkhuno kallam vacanāya
translated: When a monastic’s mind is well-purified of impediments by means of wisdom, it’s fitting for them to say:

original: ‘khīṇā jāti, vusitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ, kataṁ karaṇīyaṁ, nāparaṁ itthattāyāti pajānāmī’”ti.
analyzed: brahmacariya katam karaṇīya na aparam itthattāya ati pajānāmi iti
translated: ‘I understand: “Birth is ended, the spiritual life fulfilled, the job done. There is nothing further for this world.”’”

original: Kathañca, āvuso, bhikkhuno cetasā cittaṁ suparicitaṁ hoti?🔽‘Vītarāgaṁ me cittan’ti cetasā cittaṁ suparicitaṁ hoti;
analyzed: katham ca āvuso bhikkhuno cetasā cittam su paricitam hoti  vīta rāgam me cittam ti cetasā cittam su paricitam hoti
translated: “And how, friend Candikāputta, is a bhikkhu’s mind well consolidated by mind?🔽‘My mind is free from lust’ - thus his mind is well consolidated by mind.

original: ‘vītadosaṁ me cittan’ti cetasā cittaṁ suparicitaṁ hoti;🔽‘vītamohaṁ me cittan’ti cetasā cittaṁ suparicitaṁ hoti;
analyzed: vīta dosam me cittam ti cetasā cittam su paricitam hoti  vīta moham me cittam ti cetasā cittam su paricitam hoti
translated: ‘My mind is free from hatred’ - thus his mind is well consolidated by mind.🔽‘My mind is free from delusion’ - thus his mind is well consolidated by mind.

original: ‘asarāgadhammaṁ me cittan’ti cetasā cittaṁ suparicitaṁ hoti;🔽‘asadosadhammaṁ me cittan’ti cetasā cittaṁ suparicitaṁ hoti;
analyzed: a sa rāga dhammam me cittanti cetasā cittam su paricitam hoti  asa dosa dhammam me cittanti cetasā cittam su paricitam hoti
translated: ‘My mind is not subject to lust’ - thus his mind is well consolidated by mind.🔽‘My mind is not subject to hatred’ - thus his mind is well consolidated by mind.

original: ‘asamohadhammaṁ me cittan’ti cetasā cittaṁ suparicitaṁ hoti;
analyzed: asa moha dhammam me cittanti cetasā cittam su paricitam hoti
translated: ‘My mind is not subject to delusion’ - thus his mind is well consolidated by mind.

original: ‘anāvattidhammaṁ me cittaṁ kāmabhavāyā’ti cetasā cittaṁ suparicitaṁ hoti;🔽‘anāvattidhammaṁ me cittaṁ rūpabhavāyā’ti cetasā cittaṁ suparicitaṁ hoti;
analyzed: an āvatti dhammam me cittam kāma bhavāya ati cetasā cittam su paricitam hoti  an āvatti dhammam me cittam rūpa bhavāya ati cetasā cittam su paricitam hoti
translated: ‘My mind is not subject to bondage by the sensual realm,’ his mind is well-released.🔽‘My mind is not subject to bondage by the realm of subtle materiality,’ his mind is well-released.

original: ‘anāvattidhammaṁ me cittaṁ arūpabhavāyā’ti cetasā cittaṁ suparicitaṁ hoti.
analyzed: an āvatti dhammam me cittam arūpa bhavāya ati cetasā cittam su paricitam hoti
translated: ‘My mind is not subject to bondage by the immaterial realm,’ his mind is well-released.

original: Evaṁ sammā vimuttacittassa kho, āvuso, bhikkhuno bhusā cepi cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā cakkhussa āpāthaṁ āgacchanti, nevassa cittaṁ pariyādiyanti;
analyzed: evam sammā vimutta cittassa kho āvuso bhikkhuno bhusā ce pi cakkhu viññeyyā rūpā cakkhussa āpātham āgacchanti na iva assa cittam pariyādiyanti
translated: “When a bhikkhu’s mind is thus well released, even if he were to meet face to face with the most excellent of women, with her limbs well anointed with sandalwood ointment, her body perfumed with jasmine, her head decked with gold ornaments, her hair neatly dressed, wearing a garland, clad in white garments, her earrings shining, he would not be excited by lust.

original: amissīkatamevassa cittaṁ hoti ṭhitaṁ āneñjappattaṁ, vayaṁ cassānupassati.
analyzed: amissīkatam eva assa cittam hoti ṭhitam vayam ca ssa anupassati
translated: His mind would not be seized by her. His mind would be steady, attained to imperturbability, and he would see with right wisdom that he is subject to birth and decay.

original: Seyyathāpi, āvuso, silāyūpo soḷasakukkuko.🔽Tassassu aṭṭha kukkū heṭṭhā nemaṅgamā, aṭṭha kukkū upari nemassa.🔽Atha puratthimāya cepi disāya āgaccheyya bhusā vātavuṭṭhi, neva naṁ saṅkampeyya na sampavedheyya;
analyzed: seyyathā api āvuso silāyūpaḥ soḷasa kukkukaḥ  aṭṭha kukkū heṭṭhā nemaṅgamā aṭṭha kukkū upari nemassa  atha puratthimāya cepi disāya āgaccheyya bhusā vāta vuṭṭhi na iva nam saṅkampeyya na sampavedheyya
translated: “Suppose there were a stone column sixteen kunkurus high,🔽and a man sprinkled it once every hundred years with the tip of a robe hem.🔽That stone column would be worn away and eliminated sooner than the life span of a person who has not seen the Four Noble Truths.🔽“Suppose there were a great rain cloud extending over a hundred leagues, and a man were to sprinkle it once with the tip of a blade of grass.

original: atha pacchimāya …🔽atha uttarāya …
analyzed: atha pacchimāya 🔽atha uttarāya
translated: That great rain cloud would be diminished and eliminated sooner than the life span of a person who has not seen the Four Noble Truths.

original: atha dakkhiṇāya cepi disāya āgaccheyya bhusā vātavuṭṭhi, neva naṁ saṅkampeyya na sampavedheyya.
analyzed: atha dakkhiṇāya cepi disāya āgaccheyya bhusā vāta vuṭṭhi na iva nam saṅkampeyya na sampavedheyya
translated: and a violent storm and strong winds came from the south, they would not be able to shake or stir him.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: Why is that?

original: Gambhīrattā, āvuso, nemassa, sunikhātattā silāyūpassa.
analyzed: gambhīra ttā āvusaḥ nemassa su nikhāta ttā silā yūpassa
translated: Because the axle is deep and the stone is well-buried.

original: Evamevaṁ kho, āvuso, sammā vimuttacittassa bhikkhuno bhusā cepi cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā cakkhussa āpāthaṁ āgacchanti, nevassa cittaṁ pariyādiyanti;
analyzed: evam evam kho āvuso sammā vimutta cittassa bhikkhuno bhusā ce pi cakkhu viññeyyā rūpā cakkhussa āpātham āgacchanti na iva assa cittam pariyādiyanti
translated: In the same way, when a monk’s mind is well-released, even if violent forms come into the visual range of a monk, they don’t overpower his mind.

original: amissīkatamevassa cittaṁ hoti ṭhitaṁ āneñjappattaṁ, vayaṁ cassānupassati.🔽Bhusā cepi sotaviññeyyā saddā …🔽ghānaviññeyyā gandhā …
analyzed: amissīkatam eva assa cittam hoti ṭhitam vayam ca ssa anupassati  bhusā ca ipi sota viññeyyā saddā  ghāna viññeyyāḥ gandhāḥ
translated: His mind stays unaffected, settled, and unified within himself. He contemplates impermanence, and his mind is firm.🔽Even if violent sounds come into the range of the ear …🔽violent smells into the range of the nose …

original: jivhāviññeyyā rasā …
analyzed: jivhā viññeyyāḥ rasāḥ
translated: violent tastes into the range of the tongue …

original: kāyaviññeyyā phoṭṭhabbā …
analyzed: kāya viññeyyā phoṭṭhabbā
translated: violent touches into the range of the body …

original: manoviññeyyā dhammā manassa āpāthaṁ āgacchanti, nevassa cittaṁ pariyādiyanti;
analyzed: manaḥ viññeyyāḥ dhammāḥ manassa āpātham āgacchanti na iva assa cittam pariyādiyanti
translated: violent thoughts come into the range of the mind, they don’t overpower his mind.

original: amissīkatamevassa cittaṁ hoti ṭhitaṁ āneñjappattaṁ, vayaṁ cassānupassatī”ti.
analyzed: amissīkatam eva assa cittam hoti ṭhitam vayam ca ssa anupassati iti
translated: His mind stays unaffected, settled, and unified within himself. He contemplates impermanence, and his mind is firm.”

analyzed: chaṭṭha  aṅguttara nikāya

analyzed: sattāvāsa vagga

original: Paṭhamaverasutta
analyzed: paṭhama vera sutta
translated: The first section on fear and enmity🔽Then the householder Anāthapiṇḍika went to the Buddha,

original: Atha kho anāthapiṇḍiko gahapati yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ🔽abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho anāthapiṇḍikaṁ gahapatiṁ bhagavā etadavoca:
analyzed: atha khalu anāthapiṇḍikaḥ gahapati yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavanta  abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnam khalu anāthapiṇḍikam gahapatim bhagavān etat avoca
translated: bowed, sat down, and the Buddha said to him:

original: “Yato kho, gahapati, ariyasāvakassa pañca bhayāni verāni vūpasantāni honti, catūhi ca sotāpattiyaṅgehi samannāgato hoti, so ākaṅkhamāno attanāva attānaṁ byākareyya:
analyzed: yatas kho gahapati ariya sāvakassa pañca bhayāni verāni vūpasantāni honti catūhi ca sotāpattiyaṅgehi samannāgataḥ hoti saḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ attanā ava attānam byākareyya
translated: “When a noble disciple has ended five fears and four bonds, and has the four factors of stream-entry, they may, if they wish, declare of themselves:

original: ‘khīṇanirayomhi khīṇatiracchānayoni khīṇapettivisayo khīṇāpāyaduggativinipāto, sotāpannohamasmi avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyaṇo’ti.
analyzed: khīṇa nirayaḥ mhi khīṇa tiracchāna yoni khīṇa petti visayaḥ khīṇa apāya duggati vinipāto so utāpannaḥ ham asmi a vinipāta dhammo niyataḥ sambodhi parāyaṇaḥ ti
translated: ‘I’ve finished with hell, the animal realm, and the ghost realm. I’ve finished with all bad places. I am a stream-enterer! I’m not liable to be reborn in the lower realms, and am bound for awakening.’

original: Katamāni pañca bhayāni verāni vūpasantāni honti?
analyzed: katamāni pañca bhayāni verāni vūpasantāni honti
translated: What are the five fears and enmity that they’ve ended?

original: Yaṁ, gahapati, pāṇātipātī pāṇātipātapaccayā diṭṭhadhammikampi bhayaṁ veraṁ pasavati,
analyzed: ya gahapati pāṇa atipātī pāṇa atipāta paccayā diṭṭhadhammikam pi bhayam veram pasavati
translated: Because of killing living creatures, a person creates fear and enmity in the present life,

original: samparāyikampi bhayaṁ veraṁ pasavati, cetasikampi dukkhaṁ domanassaṁ paṭisaṁvedeti,
analyzed: samparāyikam pi bhayam veram pasavati cetasikam pi dukkham domanassam paṭisavedeti
translated: and he experiences mental pain and sorrow.

original: pāṇātipātā paṭivirato neva diṭṭhadhammikampi bhayaṁ veraṁ pasavati, na samparāyikampi
analyzed: pāṇa atipātā paṭivirataḥ na iva diṭṭhadhammikam pi bhayam veram pasavati na samparāyikam pi
translated: One who abstains from killing living beings does not arouse fear and enmity

original: bhayaṁ veraṁ pasavati, na cetasikampi dukkhaṁ domanassaṁ paṭisaṁvedeti.
analyzed: bhayam veram pasavati na cetasikam pi dukkham domanassam paṭisavedeti
translated: and he does not experience mental pain and sorrow.

original: Pāṇātipātā paṭiviratassa evaṁ taṁ bhayaṁ veraṁ vūpasantaṁ hoti.
analyzed: pāṇa atipātā paṭiviratassa evam tam bhayam veram vūpasantam hoti
translated: Thus that fear and enmity of his is abandoned.

original: Yaṁ, gahapati, adinnādāyī …pe…
analyzed: ya gahapati adinnādāyī pe
translated: “One who takes what is not given …

original: kāmesumicchācārī …
analyzed: kāmesumicchā cārī
translated: one who engages in sexual misconduct …

original: musāvādī …🔽surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhāyī surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānapaccayā diṭṭhadhammikampi
analyzed: musā vādī  surā meraya majja pamāda ṭṭhāyī surā meraya majja pamāda ṭṭhāna paccayā diṭṭhadhammikam pi
translated: one who speaks falsely …

original: bhayaṁ veraṁ pasavati, samparāyikampi bhayaṁ veraṁ pasavati, cetasikampi dukkhaṁ
analyzed: bhayam veram pasavati samparāyikam pi bhayam veram pasavati cetasikam dukkha
translated: experiences mental pain and sorrow.

original: domanassaṁ paṭisaṁvedeti, surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā paṭivirato neva diṭṭhadhammikampi
analyzed: domanassam paṭisavedeti surā meraya majja pamāda ṭṭhānā paṭivirataḥ na iva diṭṭhadhammikam pi
translated: One who abstains from false speech does not arouse fear and enmity🔽and he does not experience mental pain and sorrow.

original: Idha, gahapati, ariyasāvako buddhe aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti:

translated: Here, a noble disciple is endowed with perfect confidence in the Buddha:

translated: ‘That Blessed One is perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme guide for those who wish to train, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed.’

original: Dhamme aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti:
analyzed: dhamme avecca ppasādena samannāgataḥ hoti

translated: ‘The Dhamma is well proclaimed by the Blessed One, visible here and now, immediately effective, inviting inspection, onward leading, to be experienced by the observant for themselves.’

original: Saṅghe aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti:

translated: ‘The Sangha of the Buddha’s disciples is practising the good way …

original: anuttaraṁ puññakkhettaṁ lokassā’ti.

original: Ariyakantehi sīlehi samannāgato hoti akhaṇḍehi acchiddehi asabalehi akammāsehi bhujissehi viññuppasatthehi aparāmaṭṭhehi samādhisaṁvattanikehi.
analyzed: ariya kantehi sīlehi samannāgataḥ hoti akhaṇḍehi acchiddehi a sabalehi a kammāsehi bhujissehi viññuppasatthehi a parāmaṭṭhehi samādhi savattanikehi
translated: He is virtuous, of good character, seeing danger in the slightest fault, training in the training rules, perfect in his conduct and resort.

original: Imehi catūhi sotāpattiyaṅgehi samannāgato hoti.🔽Yato kho, gahapati, ariyasāvakassa imāni pañca bhayāni verāni vūpasantāni honti, imehi ca catūhi sotāpattiyaṅgehi samannāgato hoti, so ākaṅkhamāno attanāva attānaṁ byākareyya:
analyzed: imehi catūhi sotāpattiyaṅgehi samannāgataḥ hoti 🔽yatas kho gahapati ariya sāvakassa imāni pañca bhayāni verāni vūpasantāni honti imehi ca catūhi sotāpattiyaṅgehi samannāgataḥ hoti saḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ attanā ava attānam byākareyya
translated: He has these four qualities of a stream-enterer.

original: ‘khīṇanirayomhi khīṇatiracchānayoni khīṇapettivisayo khīṇāpāyaduggativinipāto; sotāpannohamasmi avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyaṇo’”ti.🔽Sattamaṁ.🔽Aṅguttara Nikāya 9.28
analyzed: khīṇa nirayaḥ mhi khīṇa tiracchāna yoni khīṇa petti visayaḥ khīṇa apāya duggati vinipāto so utāpannaḥ ham asmi a vinipāta dhammo niyataḥ sambodhi parāyaṇaḥ ti  sattama  aṅguttara nikāya
translated: I’m finished with hell, the animal realm, and the ghost realm. I’m finished with the lower realms. I’m a stream-enterer, no longer subject to rebirth in the lower realms, headed for sel-fulfillment.”🔽The seventh section on the seven stations for consciousness is finished.

original: Yattha kāmā nirujjhanti, ye ca kāme nirodhetvā nirodhetvā viharanti, ‘addhā te āyasmanto nicchātā nibbutā tiṇṇā pāraṅgatā tadaṅgenā’ti vadāmi.
